page.title: 01SWINFORD LANDSCAPE
page.content: {Swinford}is a rural area in south Leicestershire. The average height above sea level is 400 feet, the highest point being 501 feet. The land is gently undulating with no prominent topographical features. The River Avon and part of{Stanford Reservoir}occupy the S.E. corner. The centre of{population}is the compact village of Swinford with only{ {Stanford Hall}and five other buildings used for habitation. Swinford had dwellings and farm buildings built in various eras juxtaposed with three small modern{housing}developments and three groups of council properties. The newest properties are almost exclusively owned by non indigenous inhabitants. Proximity to the M1 and M6 motorways partly accounts for the present dormitory village situation.
